items.title: Awesome Ffmpeg Updates on Aug 13 - Aug 19, 2018
items.summary: 11 awesome projects updated on Aug 13 - Aug 19, 2018
items.content_text:
### Docs

*   [Filters](https://ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg-filters.html) - Docs for FFmpeg's powerful filter chains (scaling, cropping, concatenating, merging, etc.). This is one of my most visited links when working with FFmpeg.
*   [Man page](https://man.cx/ffmpeg) - Official FFmpeg man page.
*   [CLI flags (‚≠ê50)](https://github.com/transitive-bullshit/ffmpeg-cli-flags/blob/master/readme.md) - A comprehensive list of all FFmpeg commandline flags. Really useful for searching random flags that you come across in the wild.

### JavaScript

*   [ffmpeg-concat (‚≠ê946)](https://github.com/transitive-bullshit/ffmpeg-concat) - Concats a list of videos together using FFmpeg with sexy OpenGL transitions.
*   [ffmpeg-extract-frames (‚≠ê64)](https://github.com/transitive-bullshit/ffmpeg-extract-frames) - Extracts screenshots from a video using FFmpeg.
*   [ffmpeg.js (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/Kagami/ffmpeg.js) - Port of FFmpeg to JavaScript via Emscripten. Allows for limited FFmpeg use on the client-side.
*   [ffmpeg-static (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/eugeneware/ffmpeg-static) - Provides static FFmpeg binaries for macOS, Linux, and Windows. Very useful for CI testing.
*   [tangerine](https://github.com/niftylettuce/tangerine) - Webcam streaming service using Node.js, FFmpeg, WebSockets, and Lad.

### Community

*   [Stack Overflow](https://superuser.com/questions/tagged/ffmpeg)
*   [Mailing Lists](https://www.ffmpeg.org/contact.html#MailingLists)
*   [IRC](https://www.ffmpeg.org/contact.html#IRCChannels)
items.content_html:
Docs

  • Filters - Docs for FFmpeg's powerful filter chains (scaling, cropping, concatenating, merging, etc.). This is one of my most visited links when working with FFmpeg.
  • Man page - Official FFmpeg man page.
  • CLI flags (‚≠ê50) - A comprehensive list of all FFmpeg commandline flags. Really useful for searching random flags that you come across in the wild.

JavaScript

  • ffmpeg-concat (‚≠ê946) - Concats a list of videos together using FFmpeg with sexy OpenGL transitions.
  • ffmpeg-extract-frames (‚≠ê64) - Extracts screenshots from a video using FFmpeg.
  • ffmpeg.js (‚≠ê3.4k) - Port of FFmpeg to JavaScript via Emscripten. Allows for limited FFmpeg use on the client-side.
  • ffmpeg-static (‚≠ê1.2k) - Provides static FFmpeg binaries for macOS, Linux, and Windows. Very useful for CI testing.
  • tangerine - Webcam streaming service using Node.js, FFmpeg, WebSockets, and Lad.

Community

  • Stack Overflow
  • Mailing Lists
  • IRC

items.content_html:
Native

  • ffmpeg-gl-transition (‚≠ê695) - FFmpeg filter for applying GLSL transitions between video streams (gl-transitions).

items.title: Awesome Ffmpeg Updates on Apr 02 - Apr 08, 2018
items.summary: 8 awesome projects updated on Apr 02 - Apr 08, 2018
items.content_text:
### JavaScript

*   [fluent-ffmpeg (‚≠ê8.2k)](https://github.com/fluent-ffmpeg/node-fluent-ffmpeg) - A fluent API to [FFmpeg](http://www.ffmpeg.org). If you only use one tool from this list, it should be this one.
*   [ffmpeg-probe (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/transitive-bullshit/ffmpeg-probe) - Wrapper around ffprobe for getting info about media files.
*   [ffmpeg-generate-video-preview (‚≠ê155)](https://github.com/transitive-bullshit/ffmpeg-generate-video-preview) - Generates an attractive image strip or GIF preview from a video.
*   [ffmpeg-extract-frame (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/transitive-bullshit/ffmpeg-extract-frame) - Extracts a single frame from a video.
*   [ffmpeg-extract-audio (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/transitive-bullshit/ffmpeg-extract-audio) - Extracts an audio stream from a media file.
*   [ffmpeg-on-progress (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/transitive-bullshit/ffmpeg-on-progress) - Utility for robustly reporting progress with fluent-ffmpeg.

### Mobile

*   [simplest ffmpeg mobile (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/leixiaohua1020/simplest_ffmpeg_mobile) - FFmpeg examples for Android and iOS.

### Tutorials

*   [Learn FFmpeg libav the Hard Way (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/leandromoreira/ffmpeg-libav-tutorial)
items.content_html:
JavaScript

  • fluent-ffmpeg (‚≠ê8.2k) - A fluent API to FFmpeg. If you only use one tool from this list, it should be this one.
  • ffmpeg-probe (‚≠ê15) - Wrapper around ffprobe for getting info about media files.
  • ffmpeg-generate-video-preview (‚≠ê155) - Generates an attractive image strip or GIF preview from a video.
  • ffmpeg-extract-frame (‚≠ê16) - Extracts a single frame from a video.
  • ffmpeg-extract-audio (‚≠ê18) - Extracts an audio stream from a media file.
  • ffmpeg-on-progress (‚≠ê14) - Utility for robustly reporting progress with fluent-ffmpeg.

Mobile

  • simplest ffmpeg mobile (‚≠ê1.9k) - FFmpeg examples for Android and iOS.

Tutorials

  • Learn FFmpeg libav the Hard Way (‚≠ê10k)
